result.execSummary:
The defendant Nida Fatima was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Defendant must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

No alcohol or controlled substances.  No controlled substances  unless prescribed by a doctor and then only taken as prescribed.  AODA assessment and follow through with treatment and aftercare.  Counseling as deemed appropriate.  Random UAs as deemed appropriate by the agent, no excuses to avoid being tested.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Defendant is eligible for CIP and ERP.
Defendant must participate in any counseling deemed appropriate including but not limited to parenting classes and domestic abuse counseling.

supervisions.notes:
May be served in Wisconsin Prison system.
Consecutive to: to Count 3
Concurrent with: Count 1 with the same conditions as count 1.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample and pay for the testing.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.
Appeal rights given.
Firearms warning given.
Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and your civil rights have been restored.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 3 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations, including aftercare programming.
Obtain and maintain full-time, verifiable employment.

Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge if ot previously complied with.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Cooperate with treatment, counselig and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  No contact with persons using, possessing or selling controlled substances, except in a treatment or counseling setting.  Comply with Family Court and child support orders.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Counts 1 and 3 with the same conditions as count 1.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay court costs and the cost of supervision.  Defendant must pay the DNA surcharge.    If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
May be served in Wisconsin Prison system.
Consecutive to: to Counts 1 and 3

Status conference at 10-13-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Nida Fatima in court with attorney Munjed A. Ahmad.  Defendant Nida Fatima in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense was just retained and has not had an opportunity to even review the file. Defense asks to be heard on bond. Defense asks bond be modified to allow defendant to be released to care for her children. Defense asks that previous bonds to be reinstated. Defense indicates that defendant is contemplating moving to Racine County to attempt to take advantage of drug court. The State objects to any modification of bond. The State is considering charging the deft with a substantial number of bail jumping charges but held off to speak to new counsel. The level of deft's non compliance has been spectacular; indicating that deft has tested positive for numerous substances since on bond. 

BTC: bond modification request is denied.  Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
From Atty Ahmad re: enclosed NOR
ATTY Munjed Ahmad.
Status conference on August 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Nida Fatima in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Nida Fatima in custody.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft informed her that she is not a citizen of the US. The family has an immigration attorney. Defense requests more time to speak with deft's immigration attorney regarding her potential COP.  Status conference scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 09:00 am.

DEFENDANT HAS ALREADY POSTED $5000.00 ON 08-25-2014, THEREFORE SHE MUST POST AN ADDITIONAL $5000.00. Ct 1: 946.41(1)-Resisting/Obstructing; Ct 2: 946.49(1)(a)-BJ/Misd; Ct 3: 961.41(3g)(am)-Possession of Narcotic Drugs; Ct 4: 946.49(1)(a)-BJ/Misd; Ct 5: 961.573(1)-PDP; Ct 6: 946.49(1)(a)-BJ/Misd. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Plea hearing on August 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Nida Fatima in court with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  Sharon Ann Riek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense announced today that she is not a citizen of the US and she does have an immigration lawyer. The State does not object to the adj and asks for the Court to address bond due to ZCI violations. State asks for $10,000.00 cash in each file. Defense asks that she be allowed to walk deft over to ZCI today and inquire as to why her reporting on 5/8 wasn't noted. Deft is actively in treatment and lives with her father.

BTC: bond modification is granted. Bonds to be set at $10,000.00 cash on each of the four files. All terms and conditions previously ordered in each bond remain. DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY  Plea hearing scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 09:30 am.
